nestedSet.question: Well, why do you say so?

choice1.value: I always do things that harm me

nestedSet.question: Sounds like you're already done with yourself

choice1.value: I always do things that harm me

set2.question: Oh really? Let's find out then :)

set3.question: What do you do when faced with failure?

choice1.value: Learn from it and try again

nestedSet.question: How do you make sure you don't repeat the same mistake?

choice1.value: I reflect on my actions and improve
choice1.endGame: You are on the path to becoming a resilient and wise individual. Well done!

choice2.value: I just wing it and hope for the best
choice2.endGame: Your lack of effort makes it hard to progress. Think deeply about your approach!

nestedSet.question: What if blaming others doesn't fix anything?

choice1.value: Then I just give up and complain
choice1.endGame: You are slipping into negativity and self-pity. This leads to nowhere!

choice2.value: I manipulate situations to my advantage
choice2.endGame: Your actions are harmful to others and yourself. Reflect on this destructive path.

set4.question: What do you value most in relationships?

nestedSet.question: How do you ensure honesty in your relationships?

choice1.endGame: You are nurturing healthy and meaningful relationships. Great job!

choice2.value: I expect honesty from others but keep my secrets
choice2.endGame: This imbalance in expectations may harm your relationships. Consider being more transparent.

nestedSet.question: Why do you think controlling others is important?

choice1.value: Because it makes me feel superior
choice1.endGame: This is a toxic behavior. True strength lies in mutual respect, not domination.

choice2.value: It helps me avoid being hurt
choice2.endGame: Using control as a shield will isolate you. Reflect on healthier ways to build trust.

set5.question: You see someone struggling on the street. What do you do?

choice1.endGame: Your empathy and kindness make you a positive force in the world. Keep it up!

choice2.endGame: Turning a blind eye to others' struggles can make you cold and indifferent.

choice3.endGame: Your actions reveal a lack of empathy and kindness. Reconsider your choices.

set6.question: What motivates your actions in life?

choice1.value: Helping others and making the world better
choice1.endGame: Your selflessness and drive to improve the world are inspiring. You are becoming a truly good human!

nestedSet.question: What if your success harms others?

choice1.value: It doesn't matter as long as I succeed
choice1.endGame: Your selfishness is leading you down a harmful path. Success isn't everything.

choice2.value: Iâ€™ll try to minimize harm but won't stop
choice2.endGame: Ambition is good, but remember to balance it with compassion.

choice3.endGame: Motivating yourself with negativity and anger will only lead to more pain. Seek positive goals.
